answers.answer: Gosh, I hope things worked out OK for you.  Cellulitis is nothing to mess with, especially if you have diabetes or any other reason to be immunocompromised.  A few years ago there was more press about 'flesh eating bacteria';  there are fewer stories in the papers nowadays, but the 'bug' still exists and can do great harm, even be fatal in some cases.  In cases as you describe, you simply need an antibiotic-- and as quickly as possible.  It is too late for this situation, I realize, but for others-- if you are in this type of situation and cannot get the medication, and you can actually see the spread of redness, heat, or other signs of infection, get to the emergency room and demand treatment.  I dose of IV antibiotics would be appropriate in such a case.
